result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Lukas J. Schroeder

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: Scheduling conference on November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.
Further proceedings on October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.

3:24 pm - Defendant Lukas J. Schroeder appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Helen M. Mullison appeared by video for Lukas J. Schroeder.  Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Defendant waives their right to a preliminary hearing.  Defendant is bound over to Circuit Court Branch 2 for trial. No inducement.
ARRAIGNMENT - 
Information filed.  Copy served on defense counsel.
Not guilty plea(s) entered.  Jury calendar.
BAIL MOTION - 
The parties argue the motion. Defendant has been accepted into a sober living facility.  The State would like to see the defendant transition directly from jail into the Lotus House.  The Court will modify bail to recognizance and the defendant will sign it once a bed is available and the defendant medication program has started.  (at this time no amount of recognizance bond was stated on the record.  The Clerk asked the Court later and $5,000.00 was the set amount)
Attorney Mullison to draft the order.
Further proceedings scheduled for October 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Scheduling conference scheduled for November 16, 2022 at 10:00 am.

records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Prosecutor

records.addlTxt: Motion for Bail Modification
Helen Mullison, through Public Defender.

3:02 PM Defendant Lukas J. Schroeder appeared by video, in custody. Attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Defendant no longer wishes to file court appointed counsel paperwork - prefers to stay with public defender and will wait for them to appoint him counsel.  Court tolls time limits.
Preliminary hearing reset
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Preliminary hearing on September 22, 2022 at 03:00 pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.

2:57 pm - Defendant Lukas J. Schroeder appeared by video, in custody.  Prosecuting attorney Gail Ann Prost appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Public defender has not been able to appoint counsel yet.  The defendant wishes to proceed to the Court appointed attorney route.  The jail will provide the necessary paperwork to the defendant.  Court finds good cause to toll the time limits.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 02:30 pm.
Report from Public Defender indicating no attorney has been appointed yet.
Letter from defendant
Order to Seal Victim Impact Statement.

2:39 pm - Prosecuting attorney Anthony A. Lambrecht in court for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant Lukas J. Schroeder appeared by video, in custody, at Manitowoc County Jail.  Attorney Luke Harrison appearing in court for the defendant.  Preliminary hearing demanded.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

ADDRESS INFO for Lukas J. Schroeder
Current: Manitowoc County Jail, Manitowoc, WI 54220   (Effective: 08-08-2022)
Prior: The Haven 1000 Marshall Street, Manitowoc, WI 54220
Victim Identification Key.
RE: Burglary, on 07-26-22.
Commitment for Failure to Furnish Bail.

Order to Seal Probable Cause Statement.
The original document was titled: Probable cause statement /judicial determination
The original history event date is: 08-01-2022

BAIL HEARING - 
Defendant in custody and appearing by video from the Manitowoc County Jail.  The State informs the Court that the defendant will be charged with the crimes of burglary and bail jumping.  The matters are continued for initial appearance on 08-08-22 at 1:30 p.m. Br. 2.  Bail is set at $300.00 cash with the conditions that he have no contact with 2131 Richmond Street, Manitowoc, WI; with C.A.S., DOB: 01-02-1966 or with Rummeles Jewelry Store .   Bail not furnished and defendant is remanded into custody.  Commitment for failure to furnish bail issued.  Copy filed.
Minutes.
